stories.text:
I'm hearing a lot about search engines of late. Their increasing lack of quality, the complexity in building one.

I wonder if its not possible to have an extension of some kind, in which the users browsing activity is the mechanism by which sites are crawled.

For instance, I'd love a search engine that is the sum of HN users web activity. Perhaps that's one channel of many.

Is this feasible, and does it offer any benefit over traditional search engines that indiscriminately crawl the web?
stories.title: Ask HN: Search engine crawled by its users?
Doing laundry is about to get more expensive
Take an online journey through the history of math
Parse and transform HTML to the format you want

stories.text:
We just migrated from Freshdesk to SalesForce for our CRM and what take up 1GB in uncompressed CSV-files is eating about 5GB of table space in SalesForce.

Never seen this blowup GB in any other CRM database. This is for standard Case, Customer, Contract, Email (attachments not included).

Extending with 10GB have a very high cost compared to any other system I have seen, even after heavy discount.

I get this feeling that SalesForce is overcharging by calculating a higher database size, than what is actually used (including temp space?). Or is it any other explanations?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is SalesForce overcharging for database space?
